data.event: In their efforts to reach the Munhumutapa, the Portuguese established in 1531 two settlements far up the Zambezi â€“ one of them, at Tete, some 260 miles from the sea.

event.title: Given a Portuguese town charter in 1761

data.event: Given a Portuguese town charter in 1761, it became a city of the Portuguese Overseas Province of Mozambique in 1959.

event.title: became a city of the Portuguese Overseas Province of Mozambique in 1959

data.event: Given a Portuguese town charter in 1761, it became a city of the Portuguese Overseas Province of Mozambique in 1959.
The newly independent People's Republic of Mozambique, created in 1975 after the exodus of Mozambique's ethnic Portuguese, descended into civil war between 1977 and 1992.
